American Regional Cuisines - Food Culture and Cooking - 1st Edition (2011).pdf Gooner

Publisher: Prentice Hall; 1 edition (September 1, 2011)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0131109367
ISBN-13: 978-0131109360

Filled with colorful recipes and comprehensive information on American food culture and history, this book provides an overview of American Regional Cuisines: Food Culture and Cooking . Featuring over 300 master recipes, it examines the culture, products and cuisine of fifteen culinary regionsâ€“from New England to Hawaiiâ€“and the micro-cuisines that exist within each region. Designed for the working chef, its recipes offer an ideal format based on how professionals actually cook in restaurants. The authorsâ€™ foodservice and education backgrounds give the book the scholarly knowledge and the professional experience needed to make it an authentic reference that meets the demands of todayâ€™s culinary students
